Infectious agents *can* encourage parthenogenetic, all-female reproduction (score one for Ammonite!)

Recent papers explain how Wolbachia, a bacterium, induces parthenogenesis in parasitic wasps by manipulating sex determination. This discovery excites the writer as it parallels a concept in science fiction. The papers detail the genetic mechanisms and horizontal gene transfer involved. This manipulation could have implications for sustainable reproduction.
